key_points: Tiger Woods survived a severe single-car accident, resulting in significant leg injuries requiring surgery.
Woods is currently recovering at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.
Dr. Matt Provencher analyzed Woods' injuries and discussed his recovery and future in golf.
Woods sustained open tibia and fibula fractures, along with potential injuries to his ankle and foot.
A titanium nail was placed in Woods' tibia for stabilization.
Surgery included the release of Woods' calf compartment to avoid compartment syndrome.
Concerns include debilitation, loss of strength, early arthritis, and loss of joint motion, especially in the foot and ankle.
The healing of the talus bone, important for ankle function, is paramount for Woods.
Woods might require additional surgeries for optimal healing and function of his leg, ankle, and foot.
Woods' prognosis is uncertain, but his experience with past surgeries may aid his rehabilitation.
spokespersons: Dr. Matt Provencher (FOX Sports' injury and performance analyst, former New England Patriots team physician)
